title: Caretaker / Gardener
desc: Application Details Share Eligibility to participate on CE is generally linked to those who are years or over and in receipt of a qualifying social welfare payment for 1 year or more or 18 years and over for certain disadvantaged groups. Your eligibility will have to be verified by the Department. You can register your interest by selecting the -Register your interest- button or you can a case officer in your local Intreo Centre. Applicants should supply suitable character references and be prepared to complete a Garda vetting application form. Duties This is a developmental opportunity, no experience necessary. Accredited training will be provided to support your career.Responsibilities and Duties:. Open and lock up premises as agreed with the sponsor and Supervisor - Using the Care takers diary to set up training rooms for use. Ensure area is clean and tidy with adequate supplies. - Ensure heating system is working as and when required - Under the instruction of the CE supervisor carry out maintenance on the buildings - Ensure all health and safety at work conditions are applied and adhered to - Maintain equipment required for indoor / outdoor maintenance and upkeep - Store unused paints/materials/tools safely - Ensure the safe use of tools - Ensure there is safe signage where required for -work in progress-. - Keep outside and inside areas clean and tidy - Report issues related to the building /electrical/plumbing issues to CE Supervisor - Report matters to CE Supervisor to ensure required materials are supplied. - Carry out any other duties relevant to this position as assigned . Carry out specific duties in line with Covid-19 restrictions as requested . Weeding - To include Identifying weeds & root systems; Dealing weeds e.g. pull out, use approved weed-killers only . Cut grass / Hedge Trimming / Edging - Identify the right tool for the job; Use tools safely & correctly; Pay attention to detail . Sowing / Planting - Read labels or packets for instructions; Recognize different compost types; choose correct containers for sowing / planting out; Sow / Plant out at the correct time of year; Keep records of plants sown - , date, flowering time etc. . Take care of plants - Recognize when watering and misting are needed; Notice pests and deal with them; Notice diseases and deal with them; the safe use of pesticides Polytunnel - Assist in setting up polytunnel & ground preparation; general care of tunnel; designing planting; care of plants/watering etc.; identifying any areas needed maintenance & fixing where possible where appropriate. Attending to all health & safety Requirements - Store and use tools safely; Store pesticides safely Reporting any issues to supervisor Discussing planting designs, upcoming tasks etc. with supervisor The position will be based at County Kildare LEADER Partnership CKLP, at its premises in Kildare Town:CKLP, Presentation Convent, Meadow Road, Kildare.For more information the CE Supervisor:Paula O' Connor, - 0210160 paulacountykildarelp.ie no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK.

title: Grounds Maintenance Operative/ Gardener
desc: Grounds Maintenance Operatives/ Gardeners required to work with leading and ambitious grounds maintenance provider based in the Welwyn Garden City and the wider Hertfordshire region. Start date: ASAP Hours: Hours can vary from day to day depending on location of site, travel time paid. Minimum 40 hours Mon - Fri. Regular additional summer hours. Contract: March to October fixed-term contracts and permanent vacancies available Pay rate: £9.85 - £11.50 per hour dependant on the position and contract type Role: We are looking for a professional grounds maintenance operative/ gardener to lead a mobile team of two providing ground maintenance services within the Birmingham region. You will visit up to six commercial sites a day delivering high-quality grounds maintenance services including grass cutting, hedge/shrub pruning and weed removal/treatment. Benefits: Once taken on permanently the following company benefits will be applicable; Competitive salary, discretionary Christmas bonus, paid break time, regular additional summer hours, excellent opportunities for promotion, training and development (including annual reviews and PA1/PA6 spraying licences), pensions are available in line with prevailing legislation, Employee Assistance Programme, second opinion medical hotline, family day, death in service benefit is payable whilst commercially available, collaborative approach via regular team meetings and staff involvement. Interested? Call Sam Hayes on (phone number removed)/ / (phone number removed) or email no -- Principals only. title: Buildings Cleaner/Mobile Caretaker
desc: 1st Step Solutions have a requirement for an experienced Buildings Cleaner/Mobile Caretaker, based in Essex. Job Purpose: * To provide a mobile cleaning and caretaking service for communal areas within flats and Tower blocks town wide that we are scheduled to manage and clean on behalf of Housing Services. * Reporting to the Environmental Manager. * Liaison with team colleagues. Duties: * Provide a mobile caretaking /cleaning service as scheduled. * Using the appropriate equipment and materials as supplied, keep to scheduled cleaning tasks. * Clean methodically and safely, using warning signs. * Check all footpaths, forecourts, garage areas and communal rooms/areas are free of refuse and in a clean and tidy condition. * Leave areas bright, clean and safe for tenants. * Report damage and dumped rubbish giving clear descriptions of problems and location details. Chase outstanding problems. * Dangerous occurrences that need immediate attention, report to Repairs Centre or line manager using Mobile phone. * Liaise with tenants and manager when tenants report problems. Assist residence with day to day problems including responding to lift emergencies if appropriately trained. * Arrange for the deposal of items 'harmful to health' i.e. hypodermic syringes in the prescribed manner. * Report to the Cleansing Department any incidents of squatting or vandalism. * Report to Cleansing Department any instances of physical or verbal abuse, near misses or accidents. * Check lighting is working any lamps that need replacing using the safe working. practices. Remove covers and replace new lamp. * Check building for faults liaise, with customers on repairs. * Visual check of lifts report problems. * Provide a mobile caretaking /cleaning service as scheduled * Using the appropriate equipment & Materials as supplied, keep to scheduled cleaning tasks. * Clean methodically and safely, using warning signs * Check all footpaths, forecourts, Garage areas and communal Rooms / areas are free of refuse and in a clean and tidy condition. * Leave areas bright, clean and safe for tenants * Report damage and dumped rubbish giving clear descriptions of problems and location details. Chase outstanding problems. * Dangerous occurrences that need immediate attention, report to Repairs Centre or line manager using Mobile phone * Liaise with tenants and manager when tenants report problems. Assist residence with day to day problems including responding to lift emergencies if appropriately trained * Arrange for the deposal of items 'harmful to health' i.e. hypodermic syringes in the prescribed manner * Report to the Cleansing Department any incidents of squatting or Vandalism * Report to Cleansing Department any instances of physical or verbal abuse, near misses or accidents. * Check lighting is working any lamps that need replacing using the safe working practices. Remove covers and replace new lamp * Check building for faults liaise, with customers on repairs. * Visual check of lifts report problems. * Carry out minor repairs. * Ensure all alarms, security entrance systems and electrical cupboards are maintained in a secure and safe condition by inspection and testing. * Carry out minor repairs out in accordance with the guidelines and to the agreed standards, subject to receiving the appropriate training. * Assist senior caretaker with the delivery of fuel oils for heating systems. * Collect round report sheets every week from designated areas. * Read round report & work through schedule as printed. * Tick all work as completed. * Return sheet to designated area at end of working work. * Provide cover for other members of Cleansing Team. * Attend out of hours call out, on a rota basis. * Attend training courses as required. * Attend regular team briefings. * Participate in the annual staff development reviews. * Liaise with office staff on all relevant matters specifically breaches of tenancy agreement. * Carry out cleaning of Void properties as required by the Cleansing Department. * Carry out all the responsibilities the post with due regard the Equal Opportunity Policy. * Carry out any other duties as required. * All duties and responsibilities should be carried out in accordance with agreed Policy and Procedures, having regard to company's policy commitments to efficient service provision, promotion of Equal Opportunities and diversity, a Health & Safety culture, a customer focused approach and good employee relations. * Any other duties and responsibilities as may be determined after consultation between management and the post-holder, having always full regard for the service area's competiveness, efficiency and general viability. * Ensure your business area is presented in a manner that reflects the company image/values * Recognise health and safety matters as the highest priority in any job, task or work in which you are involved. * Work in a manner that will not endanger yourself or others through own actions. * Adhere to instructions and inform appropriate management if any health and safety conditions which may be considered unsafe are identified. Experience and Qualifications: Essential: * Basic literacy & numeracy skills. * Basic cleaning experience. * Basic knowledge and understanding of health & safety. * Understands the importance of the service quality provided to customers/clients. * Have an awareness and understanding of COSHH. * Have an awareness and understanding of Equality and Diversity. * Have good written and verbal communication skills. * Be polite, courteous, tactful conscientious & flexible. * Can use own initiative. * Able to work independently and as part of a team. * Able to undertake 'Call Out' duties. * To play a fundamental part in the Mobile Cleaning Teams and to support Caretakers in providing a complete and responsive cleaning service which complies with best value criteria. * Hold a current valid driving license. * Neat and tidy appearance. * Able to work out in all weathers. Desirable: * Repair & maintenance experience. * Basic familiarity with computer and keyboard. * BICS - Basic cleaning Certificate. * Trade Certificate. * Caretaking experience. no -- Principals only. title: Tool Maker
desc: Job Role: Tool Maker Location: South Molton Salary: Upon application Hours: Monday- Friday, Permanent Summary: Draw, design and manufacture of jigs, fixtures, Mould and press tooling etc for internal use at South Molton. To contribute and work in a team environment within the Tool-Room department. Able and willing to apply lean tools and activities throughout Job function Key responsibilities: Support internal customers with the design and manufacture of tooling requirements, to suit their needs. Produce one off or small batch quantities, drive right first-time expectations Utilising manual machining. (Centre Lathe, Mill, Grinder, Jig Borer etc.) Programming of CNC, milling, turning, EDM & WEDM will be expected. Able to evaluate and detect route cause issues, equally suggest improvements to enhance current tooling Develop & maintain close working relationship with all colleagues Prepared to be flexible with all aspects of the role Experience Requirements: Experience of Toolmaking essential Experienced working with or creating both 2D and 3D drawings Demonstrable knowledge of design and manufacture of jigs and fixtures essential Knowledge of lost wax mould tools and Press tools advantageous Basic understanding of IT skills, Microsoft Word and Excel advantageous Able to work using own initiative and unsupervised, also as part of a team Hydraulic, pneumatic or electrical knowledge desirable Experience with 3D printing desirable Good communication skillsQualification requirements: Served a recognised engineering apprenticeship or equivalent NVQ-based qualification ONC, BTEC or City & Guilds or ITEC If you feel you have the experience then please send us your CV or call us on (phone number removed). title: Relief Caretaker
desc: Relief Caretakers - Vertas Derbyshire Limited To cover areas : Ripley, Ilkeston, Long Eaton and Sandiacre 0 Hours Per Week £9.72 per hour Are you a Caretaker with experience or would you like to be trained to be an exceptional Caretaker? We can help. Would you like to work for a Company who are fanatical about engaging our colleagues, improving their wellbeing and developing their careers? If the answer is yes to the previous questions, your new opportunity is awaiting you; We're looking for a dedicated Caretaker who wants to make a difference and thrives in a challenging environment. This is a fantastic opportunity to extend your experience, or to kickstart your career with extensive training in order for you to achieve your career goals. About us: Vertas is one of the fastest growing multi-services facilities management companies in the UK. Our passion is driven by putting our colleagues and customers at the heart of everything we do. Values and Behaviours: The Caretaker will have: * Great customer service and communication skills. * Passion for sustainability. * A Team player providing an excellent service across the Vertas Group. * The ability to make the best decisions with Vertas in mind. * Listening and responding to colleagues, customers and suppliers to achieve the best outcome. * The ability to adapt and respond to change in a growing organisation. Main responsibilities include: * Carrying out day-to-day maintenance and minor repairs. * Making sure that heating, lighting and alarm systems are working properly. * Carrying out and recording basic checks and maintaining Health and Safety records. * Monitoring site stocks. * Demonstrating Health and Safety awareness and have a willingness to attend training courses including Health and Safety (all training will be provided). * Using DIY and having an ability to carry out minor repairs, general maintenance and decorating capably and you will follow a planned maintenance programme. * Undertaking cleaning duties. Vertas is committed to safeguarding the welfare of children and the successful candidate will be required to apply for an Enhanced Disclosure from the Disclosure and Barring Service and declare any cautions, convictions, reprimands or final warnings which are not protected as defined by the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exceptions) Order 1975 (as amended in 2013). Your Package: * £9.72 per hour. * Company pension scheme. * Lifeworks Staff discount scheme. * Job related training plus personal development opportunities. * Mental Health First Aiders support. * Employee Assistant Programme available 24/7. * Virtual GP Facility. * Smart Health Mental Health Support. * Online health check and fitness programme. no -- Principals only. title: Town Park Gardener
desc: 1st Step Solutions have a requirement for an experienced Town Park Gardener, based in Essex. Job Purpose: * To undertake a broad range of grounds maintenance work and mechanised operations in Harlow Town Park and Landscape Areas, safely, efficiently and with courtesy. To drive and be responsible for vehicles and equipment including on occasion ride on mowers. * Reporting to the Town Park Senior Gardener. Duties: * Maintain established shrubs by pruning or cutting back to reduce size, promote flowering, and regenerate growth and to remove damaged, diseased or dead wood. * Cut formal and informal hedges using shears, secateurs or long arm pruners. Use hedge trimmers or other powered hand tools to maximise efficiency. Remove arisings appropriately. * Control weeds and grass in shrub areas, hedge bases or obstructions using chemicals as a licenced operator. * Control weeds in hard surfaces using chemicals as a licensed PA1 and PA6 operator. * Be familiar with the Town Park. Stand-in as leading Gardener or other grounds staff with similar duties during sickness and holidays or emergencies. * Take responsibility for vehicle or item of plant and to be accountable for avoidable damage and wear. title: Senior Forest Ranger
desc: Senior Forest Ranger We’re a thriving team passionate about working together to deliver excellence, all in a natural forest environment. Set in hundreds of acres of beautiful forest Longford Forest is the perfect place for a short break in Ireland , 365 days a year. With homely accommodation, up to 100 indoor and outdoor activities and a choice of bars and restaurants, there is something for all the family, all year round. SENIOR FOREST RANGER | €12.96 per hourImagine stepping away from the desk and having 400 acres of beautiful forest as your office? The Grounds Services team is responsible for managing and maintaining the forest landscape at each of our villages, including wildlife and biodiversity surveys. Our expert teams are extremely passionate about the natural environment at Center Parcs, which our guests love to see. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the Ground Services Manager in the effective management and supervision of the department in accordance with the Company and Legislative requirements, ensuring efficient and disciplined working practices, and the highest level of guest care is provided at all times. You will oversee all aspects of Forestry and Estate work as detailed within our forest management plan and ongoing maintenance programme. You will also carry out and manage your own key task areas under the guidance of the Ground Services Manager. This role also requires you to participate in the department’s call - out rota as the senior representative of the department as required. HOURS OF WORKYou will be contracted to work 150 hours per 4 - week period on a flexible basis. title: Senior Forest Ranger
desc: We’re a thriving team passionate about working together to deliver excellence, all in a natural forest environment. Set in hundreds of acres of beautiful forest Longford Forest is the perfect place for a short break in Ireland , 365 days a year. With homely accommodation, up to 100 indoor and outdoor activities and a choice of bars and restaurants, there is something for all the family, all year round. SENIOR FOREST RANGER | €12.96 per hourImagine stepping away from the desk and having 400 acres of beautiful forest as your office? The Grounds Services team is responsible for managing and maintaining the forest landscape at each of our villages, including wildlife and biodiversity surveys. Our expert teams are extremely passionate about the natural environment at Center Parcs, which our guests love to see. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the Ground Services Manager in the effective management and supervision of the department in accordance with the Company and Legislative requirements, ensuring efficient and disciplined working practices, and the highest level of guest care is provided at all times. You will oversee all aspects of Forestry and Estate work as detailed within our forest management plan and ongoing maintenance programme. You will also carry out and manage your own key task areas under the guidance of the Ground Services Manager. This role also requires you to participate in the department’s call-out rota as the senior representative of the department as required. HOURS OF WORKYou will be contracted to work 150 hours per 4-week period on a flexible basis. This means that your days and hours of work could vary each week, but you will always receive at least your contracted hours each period. As our village is open 365 days of the year, your working hours will include weekends, public / bank holidays and during Christmas and / or New Year on a rota basis, with a premium rate of pay for hours worked on a Sunday. ABOUT YOUThe ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, with the ability to work alone and as part of a team. You should be naturally cheerful and have the ability to communicate with people. Essential requirements: FETAC level 2/3 in one of the following: Horticulture, Forestry, Countryside Management or a related fieldDriving our Ground Services vehicles onsite will be essential within this position so you must have a full clean manual driving licenceYou should have a good knowledge of natural history and have an interest in nature conservation Desirable requirements: Previous supervisory experiencePrevious experience in the use of agricultural, forestry and horticultural machinery, along with a certified competency in use of pesticides PA1 and 6a ABOUT THE BENEFITSCenter Parcs is a fantastic place to work and the benefits are as impressive as they are unique. Here are just a few: Management/Colleague Bonus SchemePension Scheme with Life AssuranceColleague Recognition and Reward Scheme – offering a choice of Center Parcs and High Street vouchersFree use of our leisure facilitiesDiscounted Center Parcs breaks20% discount in our restaurant and retail outletsAccess to Perks at Work Portal - offering a wide range of retail and leisure discountsAn Employee Assistance Program - providing support on financial, health and legal mattersExcellent opportunities for career development and progression with the opportunity to gain externally recognised qualifications no -- Principals only. title: Gardener
desc: Here at Adare Manor, our vision is to create magical experiences that people will never forget. It's about a heartfelt Irish welcome that creates a sense of belonging. It's about an openness and warmth that's full of natural character. It's about a deeper understanding of every detail from start to finish. Our vision is Beyond Everything. We are always looking for people who want to play their part in helping us write the next chapter of this magical story. Within one year of reopening the Resort, we were overjoyed to be awarded 'Hotel of the Year' at the Virtuoso Best of the Best Awards ceremony in Las Vegas in 2018. Since then, we have acquired many accolades including AA Ireland : Hotel of the Year 2019, Cond Nast Traveler Readers' Choice Awards 2019: #1 Resort in Europe and #5 in the World, IGTOA: Golf Resort of the Year 2018, Yes Chef: Afternoon Tea of the Year 2018, amongst many more. Our signature restaurant The Oak Room earned a position in the Michelin Guide Great Britain and Ireland 2020 with One Michelin Star and continues to retain it. We are now recruiting for people to join our Gardens & Grounds team. The areas of responsibility is varied but includes; The Walled Gardens, Woodland Walks, Formal Gardens, Parklands, Manor Lodges and Villas. Salary will be dependent on experience. title: Forester/Forestry Manager
desc: Forester/Forestry ManagerREF: VAC-12623County DonegalCompetitive Remuneration/Package Commensurate with ExperiencePermanent RoleBe a part of a dynamic business in the agriculture and renewable energy sector who currently require an experienced Forester to manage their forests and woodlands. We are looking for someone highly proficient and organised and can prioritise tasks and manage your own workload. You need to be flexible in your working approach and pride yourself as being approachable, proactive, ambitious and creative. Description of the role:The Forester/Forestry Manager will maintain and manage the company’s Forests. Responsible for carrying out safe and sustainable management of areas used for timber production, and natural preservation. Provide valuations on timber, trees and land and how the company can add value to the business. Liaising with management, timber merchants, contractors, customers and the general public. You need to be able to work autonomously as well as part of a team. Main Duties*Work to preserve and protect forests and woodlands.*Grant Applications, Felling, Licences & Ecological Surveys*Tree Safety Inspections.*Timber Harvesting and Marketing.*Woodland design, planting and maintenance.*Aerial Drone Images.*Woodland management plans and digital mapping.*Planning, managing budgets, and leading conservation projects.*Carrying out general maintenance work.*Arranging for contract work (e. g. planting and harvesting) to be undertaken.*Correspond with local authorities and professional bodies to advise on matters concerning land use, and the balance of economic and environmental priorities.*Carry out arboriculture method statements and impact assessments, pest and disease identification and management proposals. Other RequirementsFull Clean Driving LicenceIn return, you will benefit from a competitive remuneration package and development opportunities within a nationally recognised company with exceptional professional growth potential. How to Apply:Please send your full and up to date CV along with a cover note or email to David/Robert in our Multi-Sector team in order to apply for this role. title: Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co Laois Ref: 3339
desc: Job Role Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co Laois Ref: 3339 Location Co Laois The Farm This excitingly ambitious farm spread over a number of platforms in the vicinity of Ballycolla ,Co. Laois carries over 800 milkers. The Role Duties will consist mainly of working closely with the herd, milking, feeding, calf rearing, yard work and a nice variety of other machinery work spreading slurry, mowing silage, cattle haulage and other various tasks. The Applicant We are seeking a switched on farm assistant to complement the existing farm team. They must have a driving licence, have some experience related to the tasks outlined above and be able to bring their A game consistently on to the farm workplace. Accommodation A one bed apartment is available for the successful applicant. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. title: Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co. Tipperary …
desc: Job Role Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co. Tipperary Ref: 3348 Location Co. Tipperary The Farm Located near Nenagh in Tipperary this farm carries 150 cows and is divided into a number of platforms. Milking is done in either a 14 unit or a 12 unit parlour. The Role We are seeking somebody to work alongside the farm owner. Main duties will be the usual typical commercial dairy duties such as milking, feeding calves, calving cows, cleaning and maintenance of yards. Strong machinery skills are essential in this role and there will be quite a lot of operating tractors between the different platforms so competence and confidence in driving machinery on the road is absolutely essential. The Applicant A person who is capable of performing all the duties outlined above is required here. Accommodation There is no accommodation on the farm but accommodation locally is an option for the right candidate. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application. Thank you for your interest and application. no -- Principals only. title: Pipe Fitters/ Electricians
desc: Looking for Industrial pipe fitters and Industrial Electricians to join our Bio pharma manufacturing plant on an installation project starting in May for a 6 month contract. Position Summary for Electricians:As an Electrician you will apply electrical theory and related knowledge to testing, building and modifying various types of electrical equipment and components by reading and interpreting drawings. Responsibilities:Work from plans, sketches, blueprints, work orders or other instructions; interpret electrical plans and specifications; check for compliance with codesClean, test, troubleshoot and repair high voltage equipment as necessary. Receive components and confirm against drawing and/or list of materials or quality standards. Solder and or fit/or assemble components. Fabricate specialty parts. Recommend improvements. Follows all safety rules and policies. Inspect fabrications for quality, safety and operation as requested. Audit equipment against drawings as requested. Prepare equipment for shipment. Fabricate specialty partsExecute other tasks as assignedAbility to travel when requiredQualifications:Electrical Senior Trade Certificate (Level 6) or equivalentHighly skilled electrical and instrumentation disciplines with some knowledge of mechanicalExcellent analytical and communication skills. Experience in Electrical systemsTypical work is in a manufacturing environment or customers sitePosition Summary for Pipe Fitters As an Assembler you will fabricate mechanical parts, pieces or products using a variety or tools and equipment according to required specifications. ResponsibilitiesFabricate equipment accurately and with proper procedures in a timely manner. Strong attention to detail and accuracy in fabrication processKnowledge of all types of hand tools, fabricating equipment, measuring devicesWork on stainless steel fabrication, including to but not limited to:o Cutting tubeo Operate hand grinderso Polishingo Bendingo AssemblyNDT/Liquid Penetrate all inside welds on an electro polished vesselsInstall and maintain utility/ service linesOperate overhead crane and/or forkliftPhysically capable of wearing protective eye, ear, and head gear. Must be able to stand 8+ hours per day. title: General Labor
desc: OverviewFlex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in “Automotive News.” A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals. Scope of the PositionManufacturing plant looking for ideal candidates who will be able to stand for 8 - 12 hours and lift up to 20 lbs between shoulder and knee level. Availability for overtime a requirement. ResponsibilitiesAssemble, load and unload machines/inspect parts that are being packed, consistent lifts 10 to 20 pounds or greater, clean, sweep, general labor work. Includes, but not limited to, using hand tools to insert screws, clips , read, write, walk, bend, carry, inspect, stoop, reach, twist, and stand intermittently. QualificationsHigh School Diploma or EquivalentPrevious manufacturing experience preferred. Can work in extreme cold, hot, and/or dusty environment. Be punctual with good attendance. Prior forklift experiences preferred, but not required. Background check and drug test apply. Benefits • Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance; and a flexible spending account • 401(k) retirement savings plan with company match • Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement • Paid holidays and vacation time What do our employees have to say?“It engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.”“Lots of growth opportunity.”“The company’s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.”Not just a job—a great place to work! Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer. EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled.#NoCB no -- Principals only. title: Forester/Forestry Manager
desc: Forester/Forestry Manager REF: VAC-12623 County Donegal Competitive Remuneration/Package Commensurate with Experience Permanent Role Be a part of a dynamic business in the agriculture and renewable energy sector who currently require an experienced Forester to manage their forests and woodlands. We are looking for someone highly proficient and organised and can prioritise tasks and manage your own workload. You need to be flexible in your working approach and pride yourself as being approachable, proactive, ambitious and creative. Description of the role: The Forester/Forestry Manager will maintain and manage the company’s Forests. Responsible for carrying out safe and sustainable management of areas used for timber production, and natural preservation. Provide valuations on timber, trees and land and how the company can add value to the business. Liaising with management, timber merchants, contractors, customers and the general public. You need to be able to work autonomously as well as part of a team. Main Duties *Work to preserve and protect forests and woodlands. *Grant Applications, Felling, Licences & Ecological Surveys *Tree Safety Inspections. *Timber Harvesting and Marketing. *Woodland design, planting and maintenance. *Aerial Drone Images. *Woodland management plans and digital mapping. *Planning, managing budgets, and leading conservation projects. *Carrying out general maintenance work. *Arranging for contract work (e.g. planting and harvesting) to be undertaken. *Correspond with local authorities and professional bodies to advise on matters concerning land use, and the balance of economic and environmental priorities. *Carry out arboriculture method statements and impact assessments, pest and disease identification and management proposals. Other Requirements Full Clean Driving Licence In return, you will benefit from a competitive remuneration package and development opportunities within a nationally recognised company with exceptional professional growth potential. How to Apply: Please send your full and up to date CV along with a cover note or email to David/Robert in our Multi-Sector team in order to apply for this role. For a full list of jobs we currently have available please, visit our website. 3D Personnel is operating as an Employment Agency and Business. Equality is at the forefront of our operation and we provide equality of opportunity to everyone. You can review our Privacy Policy on the home page of our website no -- Principals only. title: Head Gardener (Live-in position)
desc: Head Gardener (Live - in position) Job overview: Our client is seeking to recruit a full - time experienced Live - in Head Gardener for a Private Garden (newly built) in the Cavan area. To apply you should have a love of gardening and horticulture. You should have proven experience working as a Head gardener in private gardens or estate gardens preferably. You should also have obtained a qualification in horticulture. You will be a caretaking presence on - site generally and will have some light house keeping and cleaning duties in the adjacent holiday home also. Accommodation is provided on site, and it will be possible to have a spouse or partner live - in with you also. A farm manager is on site and you will report to him on a day to day basis, but you will have primary responsibility for the one to two acre garden and onsite buildings. Requirements: Proven experience in Horticulture, especially in Garden Maintenance and ability to operate garden tools and machinery while carrying out all works necessary for the maintenance of the garden. A recognised qualification in Horticulture or a related field should be held. Available to live at the provided accommodation and to be a presence onsite to maintain and take care of the garden and accommodations. Access to your own transport required due to location of property. You must be legally allowed to work in Ireland (stamp 4 visa or citizenship of Ireland, UK or EU). Responsibilities: You will maintain this one - acre garden site to a high standard, taking care of all aspects of maintaining this newly landscaped Private Garden throughout the year. You will liaise with the owners on any issues where necessary. You will primarily be responsible for the Garden; however, you will also have light house duties to maintain the holiday home and your own two - bedroom loft accommodation also. Benefits and additional Information: €30,000 plus free two bedroom on site accommodation – newly built DOE. Live in accommodation and possibility to have a spouse or partner live and work with you. Great opportunity for suitable applicant to live a quiet, relaxed lifestyle and work flexibility. Full WiFi on site which would allow for a WFH partner when not working on site Interested? Apply now! no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK.

desc: Job Role General Farm Worker/Stockperson in Co Cork Ref: 3257 Location Co Cork The Farm Dairy Farm in Co. Cork The Role Milking 530 cows in a 50 bail dairymaster rotary parlour. There are always 2-3 people milking. Split of 40/60 Autumn/Spring calving. All cattle fed with diet feeder in the winter time. Some machinery experience would be an advantage but not essential. The Applicant The ideal candidate needs to be an excellent Stockperson with responsibility for milking with 2 other staff during the Summer months and 3-4 other staff during the winter months. The successful candidate should also be able to spot, bulling, sick cows, lameness and a cow that may not be in 100% health. This farm also has the dairymaster moo monoter collars on all cows. title: General Farm Worker / Milker in Co. Kerry Ref: 3312
desc: Job Role General Farm Worker / Milker in Co. Kerry Ref: 3312 Location Co. Kerry The Farm Dairy Farm in County Kerry only 3 miles for the stunning town of Dingle. This farm is very clean with a very simple layout that cuts down on intensive labour . The Role Milking 260 cows through a Delaval herringbone parlour. Most of the machinery work is contracted out, however, some machinery work such as slurry, topping, shaking will need to be carried out. The farmer is looking for someone who is enthusiastic and looking for a long term career in farming. The farmer does the morning milking so the successful candidate would not be starting until 09.30am, working through the day and finishing with the evening milking. The Applicant The successful candidate would have experience in milking and have a keen interest in a farming career. He/she needs to be confident in driving machinery or show an interest in learning. Must be able to work on your own initiative. Training will also be provided if the candidate does not have the appropriate experience but is willing to learn. A great opportunity for someone looking to pursue a career in farming. Accommodation Accommodation provided at a very good rate. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application. Thank you for your interest and application. no -- Principals only. title: Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co. Kerry Ref: 3150
desc: Job Role Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co. Kerry Ref: 3150 Location Co. Kerry The Farm The Farm: A farm spread over several blocks in the Listowel area of North Kerry .There is a 200 cow herd currently milking through a 12 unit parlour with advanced plans for a new parlour in 2021. The Role The Role: The farm owner is seeking an offsider to help him in the running of all aspects of the farm. The successful applicant will be expected to contribute in the areas of herd management, milking, animal husbandry, grassland management, farm maintenance and equipment operation and repair The Applicant The person needs to have good experience in a similar role and be confident that following a period of orientation and training that he/she will be able to take full responsibility on occasions for the sole running of the commercial operation of this farm. As the farm is fragmented a full drivers licence is essential for this position. Accommodation There is no accommodation provided in this role. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application .Thank you for your interest and application no -- Principals only. title: Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co Kildare …
desc: Job Role Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co Kildare Ref: 3263 Location Co Kildare The Farm A 280 cow farm not far from the rolling plains of the Curragh. Beautifully set up with a 26 unit parlour with all mod cons this is a great farm to work on. The Role This is a typical dairy farm assistant herdsman`s role with an interesting variety of tasks. Prime amongst them is milking and looking after the ladies in the herd but also there will be calf rearing, yard work, field work , slurry spreading, fencing and general farm maintenance. A really attractive roster sets this position apart. It is envisaged that from January to June you will work 11 days on and 3 days off and from June to December it will be a 10 day on 4 day off. The Applicant We seek a person who has some experience of working on a commercial dairy farm .They will need to enjoy working with cows and have the patience and demeanour to keep the parlour operating in peace and harmony so the man and beast can savour the experience. Accommodation There is no accommodation provided with this job so somebody who lives in or can commute into the Kildare/ Rathangan area is required here. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application. Thank you for your interest and application. no -- Principals only. title: Caretaker (Retirement Living)
desc: Caretaker (Retirement Living) Hauxton, Cambridge Full Time (37 hours per week) Permanent Salary £19,536.11 bpha are a forward-thinking housing association, on a mission to build thriving communities where people can live happily in a home they can afford. We work right across the Oxford to Cambridge Arc, and own or manage over 19,000 homes. As one of the top 25 housing association developers in the country, we remain committed to delivering high-quality affordable housing to those who need it the most. Our work in retirement living is no exception. We believe in creating modern communities where over-55s can live in desirable, social, independent spaces. Safe in the knowledge that we have extra tailored care and support available if it’s needed. This is all possible thanks to our dedicated and passionate retirement living team. A team that you could be part of. We are currently looking for Caretaker to provide an efficient and effective caretaking service . Full training will be provided. What you will be doing: * Attend quickly and effectively to emergencies as required during the working day. * Ensure that all communal areas inside (such as corridors, communal areas guest rooms and toilets) and outside are kept clean and tidy and safe from any obstructions. * To carry out general basic maintenance and minor repairs as required. * Carrying out health & safety inspections. * Liaising with customers and other service users. * Due to the nature of the role you may be required to travel to different locations. We’d love to meet someone with: * Demonstrate transferable skills. * Have an understanding and/or experience of the needs of older people. * Can demonstrate high levels of customer service in a customer facing role. * Is self-motivated, quick to learn and can work on own initiative. * Has good knowledge of Health and Safety. * Has a professional and positive attitude and works well as part of a team. Amongst what we offer you is: * A competitive salary of £19,536.11 * 28 days holiday PLUS Bank Holidays * A generous contributory pension scheme * Private health care * Free life assurance * Access to an extensive suite of wellbeing services and tools including a digital gym * Opportunities for learning and development * Discounted gym membership * Retail discount scheme Please note the successful candidate will be required to complete an enhanced DBS application and this will need to be returned and verified by bpha before a start date can be provided. Closing date: 29th March, 2022 Interview date: To be confirmed We reserve the right to close this recruitment if it is deemed that we have received a suitable number of applications. On this basis we would advise that applications are submitted as soon as possible. no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK.

title: Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Limerick Ref: 3289
desc: Job Role Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Limerick Ref: 3289 Location Limerick The Farm Dairy farm in County Limerick located close to parks, pitch and put and a sports complex. The Role The Role: The successful candidate will be overseeing the farm under the owner. There are two milking parlours, a 12 unit and a 16 unit. The successful candidate will be looking after the 12 unit parlour with 160-170 cows coming through this. Overall, there are in excess of 400 cows being milked. The Applicant The Applicant: The successful candidate needs to be confident in making managerial decisions. He/she needs to have experience in milking, animal health and looking after the herd. Machinery experience would be a bonus but not essential. Accommodation Accommodation: Not available, however, accommodation can be source nearby at a commercial rate. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application .Thank you for your interest and application no -- Principals only. title: Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co Laois Ref: 3308
desc: Job Role Assistant Herdsperson/General Farm Worker in Co Laois Ref: 3308 Location Co Laois The Farm This is a modern farm with 110 cows being milked through a two unit robotic system. There is a mixture of indoor feeding and paddock grazing. The Role This is an interesting and varied role involving a mixture of looking after the milking herd and machinery work. It will expose successful applicants to cutting edge farming techniques and will really give them an insight to what commercial dairying in the future will look like. The Applicant A person with a range of farm skills is required here. Will need to be able to look after the two key duties outlined above. A successful applicant will have a keeen interest in cows Accommodation There is no accommodation with this job. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application. Thank you for your interest and application. no -- Principals only. title: General Farm Worker / Milker in Co. Kerry Ref: 3302
desc: Job Role General Farm Worker / Milker in Co. Kerry Ref: 3302 Location Co. Kerry The Farm Dairy Farm in County Kerry close to the town of Listowel located on 330 acres. This farm is very clean with a very simple layout that cuts down on intensive labour . The Role Milking 170 cows through a 20 unit Dairy Master cluster remover parlour. Most of the machinery work is contracted out, however, some machinery work such as slurry, topping, shaking will need to be carried out. The farmer is looking for someone who is enthusiastic and looking for a long term career in farming. The Applicant The successful candidate must have experience in milking and have a keen interest in a farming career. He/she needs to be confident in driving machinery. Must be able to work on your own initiative. Training will also be provided if the candidate does not have the appropriate experience but is willing to learn. Accommodation Accommodation provided. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application. Thank you for your interest and application. no -- Principals only. title: General Farm Worker / Milker in Limerick Ref: 3303
desc: Job Role General Farm Worker / Milker in Limerick Ref: 3303 Location Limerick The Farm 300 acre Dairy farm in County Limerick located close to Ardpatrick and only a 20min drive to the Ballyhoura mountains. The Role The role includes milking 120 cows through a 12 unit parlour, driving farm machinery and other general farm work. The Applicant The successful candidate needs to have experience in milking and driving farm machinery. If you do not have the relevant experience but you are willing to learn and have an interest in a farming career, the farmer is willing to train you. A great opportunity for someone looking to start a farming career. Accommodation There is a 2 bedroom mobile located on the farm. ESB is paid for by the farmer. Additional Info Contact will be made with those applicants that have suitable experience for the role advertised. Unfortunately due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot reply to each application. Thank you for your interest and application. no -- Principals only. title: Gardener
desc: Job Description Share We at Ballynatray Estate, Youghal, Co. Cork are seeking an enthusiastic, qualified gardener to work with our team on our beautiful estate and gardens where among other gardens and grounds. We have 2 walled gardens and we are re-developing our kitchen garden. Our ideal candidate would have previously demonstrated strong gardening experience in a similar role. The Gardener should: 1. Have a full driving licence and be experienced with small and medium size machinery, this is a distinct advantage. 2. Show ability to operate on their own with minimal supervision as well as working as a wider team. 3. Have a good knowledge of grass care, lawn maintenance and of general ground care maintenance 4. Have practical knowledge of the operation of grass cutting machinery, strimmer's etc 5. Have competent skills in ornamental gardens, particularly as the estate contains walled gardens with a variety of flowers, shrubs, vegetables and plants for various seasons. 6. Have an in-depth understanding of planting, maintaining, and providing nourishment to the wide range of plants is essential. 7. Show enthusiasm to learn and be adaptable to the work involved within the estate. 8. Be willing to carry out any other reasonable work that is directed by the Estate Manager. 9. Attention to detail is essential. Career Level Experienced Non-Managerial Candidate Requirements Essential Minimum Experienced Required (Years): 0 Minimum Qualification: No Qualification Desirable Ability Skills: Customer Service , Manual Competency Skills: Labouring, Teamwork Specialising In: gardening skills Driving Licence: Full B > no -- Principals only. title: Caretaker
desc: Share The Anne Sullivan Centre located on Brewery Road, Stillorgan opened in 1996 and is the first residential setting in Ireland supporting individuals who are deafblinde provide residential, day and outreach services to adults who are deafblind, enabling them to pursue meaningful, active and fulfilling livesr>At present, we are looking to recruit a part-time Caretakern this role, you will be working with management and staff, to ensure that the ASC premises, houses, grounds and transport are maintained in line with Residents- needs and with current health and safety legislation and regulationsr>Key ResponsibilitiesExternal Maintenance and Grounds- Maintaining gardens and grounds of ASC, houses and day service as necessary Leaf blowing, grass cutting, hedging, fence repair- Maintaining the external of ASC buildings roof, eaves, windows, doors and locks, signage etc- Managing and maintaining carpark area- Contacting and coordinating external contractors, as necessaryInternal Maintenance- Maintenance and checks of appliances, heating, plumbing, alarm systems and coordinating contractors as required- Repair and maintenance of fixtures and fittings such as locks, doors, blinds, key cutting, flooring, presses, lights, light fittings and painting- Assembling equipment and furnitureTransport- Weekly safety checks of vehicles, coordination of washing, repair and servicing of vehiclesAdditional responsibilities- Waste Management- Monitoring stocks of personal protective equipment, soap, sanitizers and dispensers- Driving ASC and Day service buses- Managing collection and storage of deliveries PPE, First Aid, cleaning supplies, food supplies- Liaise with external contractors when they are on siteHealth, Safety and Hygiene- Adhere to Health & Safety standards, policies and procedures and ensure that the safety, security and cleanliness of the ASC is upheldCommunication and Teamwork- Attend Health and Safety Meetings- Share information with the ASC team that has a direct impact on the safety and security of the premisesOther DutiesUndertake related duties assigned by the Manager, as necessaryr>Hours of WorkFlexible Part-time hours - 10 to 15 hours weekly on site in Stillorgan, Co with the occasional visit to Cabra, Dublinr>Role Requirements- Experience in a similar Caretaker/Maintenance role would be a distinct advantage- Full Clean Driver-s Licence- An interest in supporting people with disabilities to live full and active livesAdditional InformationInduction training will be providedThis position is subject to Reference checks and Garda Vetting no -- Principals only. title: Pipe Fitters
desc: We are? A leading specialist engineering services company delivering integrated solutions for complex energy and infrastructure projects and operating assets. Our business is built on the belief that our people are what make EnerMech excellent. When we are thriving globally it’s not just about investing in our infrastructure, service offering and technology, but by also investing in our people. The role? You will need to carry out pipe bending, pipe joining, pipe fitting, inspection and testing along with fault diagnosis in your role. In order to do this you will be able to read construction drawings and specifications and adhere to these. You will also need to fabricate piping for welders in the workshop and field environment and to install pipework in the field including setting out pipe systems and brackets. You will prepare non-welded joints and install non-welded pipe systems. Understanding the basic principles regarding various metal types and their installation will be useful and the risk of cross contamination of Stainless Material and the impact of this on installed pipe. Lastly you will assist in the testing of piping systems and ensure your workplace is kept safe and tidy, compliant to any local site rules. You are? Someone who is time served and experienced in pipefitting with a safe pass and manual handling. High purity experience ideally (although not essential). You will ideally have some clean-room experience but it is not essential. Diversity & Inclusion At EnerMech we want to create a diverse and inclusive organisation and grow together to make a vibrant business. We are not there yet, but the desire is steadfast, so please consider a career with us in an organisation where differences in background, culture, education, working style and less obvious differences are respected and celebrated. no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK.

title: Caretaker
desc: Caretaker Gloucester £20,851.00 per annum Permanent, Full Time (37 hrs per week) Closing Date: 24th March 2022 Interview/Assessment Date: 28th March 2022 * Are you great with people? * Do you have a passion for customer excellence? * Do you have an amazing telephone manner? * Are you keen to work with the local community? * Would you like to make a difference? If the answer to the above is yes, then our client is looking for talented customer centric individuals to join their team. They are looking for individuals who are engaging, confident and understand the importance of delivering an exceptional customer journey for all of their tenants. This is a truly unique chance to be part of a team that is fully focussed on a first call resolution approach and be the heart of the organisation. Why should you join our client? Our client is a dynamic social housing provider with over 4,600 homes in the city. They have a strong track record of success and a clear vision for the future. They are one of the Housing sectors’ leading community-based Housing Association, ranked at No 40 in the Times Top 100 not-for-profit companies to work for. The development of their people and their commitment to customer excellence is the core reason why they have created a new team to be the focal point of their day-to-day contact with all their tenants. So, what is the purpose of the role? * The overall purpose is providing a good standard of maintenance and repairs to their homeless accommodation service . * To be responsible for the condition of the homeless accommodation, conducting regular inspections both internal and external. Reporting any repairs that are outside of your remit to the main repair and maintenance team. * Liaising with and working alongside their homeless accommodation officers to achieve relevant targets of 36 hours within their homeless schemes. * Conducting Health and Safety requirements such as fire alarm, and water testing to ensure that the schemes are compliant and meet specific compliant deadlines. * To work with their part time caretaker to maintain the gardens and grounds at their homeless schemes, which includes mowing the lawn, maintaining shrubbery, and cleanliness of all bin storage areas to encourage recycling where appropriate. They are looking for someone who is flexible, reliable with a can-do attitude. You will have the ability to drive or access to transport is essential. You will need to understand the vulnerable customers they work with. You will also have a sense of fun with good communication skills as the job role can be demanding and an ability to prioritise your workload is useful. To provide a great experience to all customers, is essential and being customer centric fostering a positive customer experience. To be responsible for minor repairs and maintenance, Health, and Safety compliance, decorating and cleaning of their properties to enable the properties to be released within 36 hours. As an ambassador, you will need to be strong at building and maintaining relationships across our client and with their customers to support effective service delivery and great customer experience. Not only is our client a great place to work, but they also offer some excellent benefits such as a: * 30 days holiday per annum (pro rata) * Buying & Selling of holidays * Life Event leave * Access to a benefits portal * Competitive salary, * Social Housing pension scheme, * Employee wellbeing package, * Healthcare plan, * Employee Assisted Programme * Trust based working * Cycle to work scheme * Community impact day * Volunteering day of your choice * Potential learning pathways with qualifications * plus a town centre office with nearby parking for our permanent office based employees Our client is committed to equal opportunities and actively encourages applications from all sections of the community. no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK. This is a part-time job.

title: Caretaker
desc: Barker Ross Healthcare are currently recruiting for Caretakers to work in Ollerton, Nottinghamshire As Caretaker you will be required to perform duties to include: The security of the premises, together with its contents and attending to the intruder alarm where applicable. Attending to the heating system and ensuring that the boiler plant equipment etc are cleaned and maintained ensuring any faults are reported. Handyperson duties of all types: includes all repairs and maintenance that do not require the services of a skilled craftsman and which are not covered by a service or maintenance contract. The cleaning of designated areas and maintaining floor surfaces. Attending to and cleaning up after spillages. Portering duties Ensuring that all the exterior areas are kept clean and tidy and emptying of litter bins, the cleaning of drains and gulleys, the salting and de-icing of hard surfaces during the winter months and the moving of snow to ensure access to the premises. To give adequate supervision and direction advice to supervisory and cleaning operatives and to maintain the required records of time sheets, attendance, leave, sickness absence etc.. To record all deliveries and maintain the required information in the logbooks, stock cards, etc., and to ensure that adequate supplies including fuel are maintained to meet the needs of the establishment and Building Cleaning Services. To be available and attend to the requirements of the hirer's of the premises for the purpose of lettings if appropriate. Taking reasonable care for the Health and Safety of themselves and of other persons who may be affected by their activities. A complete list of duties is available upon request Pay Rate :£10.00 per hour. Temporary ongoing contract - 35hrs per week, Monday to Friday If you are intersted, please apply to Martine at Barker Ross Healthcare no -- Principals only. title: Mobile Caretaker
desc: Mobile Caretakers - Vertas Derbyshire Limited To cover areas : Ilkeston, Long Eaton and Sandiacre 15 hours per week, 52 weeks per year Monday to Friday Various working patterns - between 7am&6pm £9.72 per hour Are you a Caretaker with experience or would you like to be trained to be an exceptional Caretaker? We can help. Would you like to work for a Company who are fanatical about engaging our colleagues, improving their wellbeing and developing their careers? If the answer is yes to the previous questions, your new opportunity is awaiting you; We're looking for a dedicated Caretaker who wants to make a difference and thrives in a challenging environment. This is a fantastic opportunity to extend your experience, or to kickstart your career with extensive training in order for you to achieve your career goals. About us: Vertas is one of the fastest growing multi-services facilities management companies in the UK. Our passion is driven by putting our colleagues and customers at the heart of everything we do. Values and Behaviours: The Caretaker will have: * Great customer service and communication skills. * Passion for sustainability. * A Team player providing an excellent service across the Vertas Group. * The ability to make the best decisions with Vertas in mind. * Listening and responding to colleagues, customers and suppliers to achieve the best outcome. * The ability to adapt and respond to change in a growing organisation. Main responsibilities include: * Carrying out day-to-day maintenance and minor repairs. * Making sure that heating, lighting and alarm systems are working properly. * Carrying out and recording basic checks and maintaining Health and Safety records. * Monitoring site stocks. * Demonstrating Health and Safety awareness and have a willingness to attend training courses including Health and Safety (all training will be provided). * Using DIY and having an ability to carry out minor repairs, general maintenance and decorating capably and you will follow a planned maintenance programme. * Undertaking cleaning duties. Vertas is committed to safeguarding the welfare of children and the successful candidate will be required to apply for an Enhanced Disclosure from the Disclosure and Barring Service and declare any cautions, convictions, reprimands or final warnings which are not protected as defined by the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exceptions) Order 1975 (as amended in 2013). Your Package: * £9.72 per hour. * Company pension scheme. * Lifeworks Staff discount scheme. * Job related training plus personal development opportunities. * Mental Health First Aiders support. * Employee Assistant Programme available 24/7. * Virtual GP Facility. * Smart Health Mental Health Support. * Online health check and fitness programme. no -- Principals only. title: Tooling Maintenance Technician
desc: Our client are an established, expanding manufacturing business currently looking to recruit a Tooling Maintenance Technician to join their business. Overall Purpose: To work in advance of the production plan to ensure that all injection and extrusion mould tools and ancillary equipment are correctly prepared, set and ready for production according to product drawing specifications and in line with the standards laid down by the Tooling Coordinator.Key Duties: To repair and maintain all tools on maximum cavities. To repair and maintain all ancillary equipment. To service and maintain all tool room equipment. Follow the production plan, one week in advance to ensure all tooling is correctly built up to produce the required part and is ready for production. Perform insert changes. Undertake routine tool repair and maintenance. Undertake hot runner maintenance. Polish tools to a mirror finish when required. Manufacture, modify and service ancillary equipment when required. Maintain and service tool room machinery. General machine work when required. Obtain quotes from suppliers. Inform Coordinator of any quotes or spares required. Aid and assist all departments with technical knowledge and expertise when required. This list is not exhaustive and includes any reasonable request by the Tooling Coordinator consistent with role, skills and ability.Key Skills & Experience Required: Ideally have a recognised apprenticeship. Ideally have mould tooling experience however not essential. The Package: £31,971.72 per annum. Day shift position: 8:15AM - 5PM Mon - Thurs & Fri 8:15AM - 1:45PM. Pension scheme. Holiday package. OTE. no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK.

title: Gardener
desc: 1st Step Solutions have a requirement for an experienced Gardener, based in Essex. Job Purpose: * To undertake a broad range of grounds maintenance work and mechanised operations in public parks, playing fields, housing areas and open spaces, safely, efficiently and with courtesy. * To drive and be responsible for Ride on Mowers and fulfil the role of Watchperson. * Reporting to the Gardening Supervisor. Duties: * Maintain established shrubs by pruning or cutting back to reduce size, promote flowering, and regenerate growth. * Cut formal and informal hedges safely using appropriate hand tools or powered hand tools where necessary to maximise efficiency. * Control weeds and grass in shrub areas, hedge bases or obstructions using chemicals as a licenced operator. * Control weeds in hard surfaces using chemicals as a licensed PA1 and PA6 operator. * Cut grass, be aware of rare wild flowers occurring in turf and take appropriate action. * Form and maintain edges to grass areas. Strim around obstacles to leave tidy appearance of grass. * Take appropriate Health and Safety action during adverse weather conditions and machinery breakdown. * Provide absence or emergencies cover for the Leading Gardener or other grounds staff. * Clear leaves, litter and rubbish from landscaped areas. * Carry out clearance works on gardens, allotment plots, shrub beds. * Help prepare ground for planting by hand. Use rotavators or other machinery as required. * Assist with the cultural maintenance of grass on amenity or sports areas using hand tools or pedestrian operated machinery. Tasks to include scarification, slitting, spiking, topdressing, levelling, sanding, fertilising, over seeding, draining, rolling and watering. * Be aware of correct timing, weather and ground conditions for seeding. * Sow by hand or mechanical distributor and carry out appropriate aftercare to lead to the successful establishment of a grass sward. * Assist with the interpretation of specifications, the maintenance, restoration and layout of specialist horticultural areas such as rose gardens and war memorials. * Contribute to the establishment and maintenance of bulbs, annuals, perennials, bedding and floral displays, hanging baskets and all other ornamental planting. * Plant shrubs, hedging and trees utilising a range of techniques appropriate to the site conditions, size and presentation of plant material. * Be aware of legal requirements and safety regulations in respect of the vehicle or item of plant. * Comply with the council's fault and accident reporting procedures. * Carry out drivers' safety and mechanical checks before the vehicle is taken on the road. * Maintain vehicle logbook where applicable. * Take responsibility for vehicle, item of plant or equipment and to be accountable for avoidable damage and wear. Be responsible for the security of the machine or equipment whilst at work. Carry out daily and weekly maintenance. Change blades and belts as necessary. * Drive the vehicle safely and with consideration to others. * Be a Watchperson for tractor/flail operations including hedge cutting and movement in public areas such as footpaths/roads ensuring the safety of the public. * Carry out communication by hand signals and radio when vision is restricted. * Operate machine to obtain economic fuel use whilst maintaining maximum efficiency and work output. * Understand the relevant risk assessment and method statement. Carry out pre-start check before commencing work. Operator to record check on pre-start risk assessment form. * Be aware and maintain general safe and healthy working practices including those set out in the risk assessments in relation to the task being carried out. Respond and take appropriate action in emergencies. * Carry out works adjacent to roads, cycle tracks and footpaths using signs, layouts and methods of work as detailed in "Safety at Street works and Roadworks". * Report hazards to line management and safety representatives and record accidents promptly and accurately. Experience and Qualifications: Essential: * Basic knowledge and understanding of Health and Safety. * Practical gardening experience. * Literacy and numeracy skills. * Planting and pruning techniques. * Able to use powered hand tools and machinery. * Ability and confidence to use own initiative. * Good verbal communication skills. * Willingness to work as part of a team. * Plant, equipment and vehicle when in use at work. * Valid full driving licence. Desirable: * Experience of using a ride on mower. * Hold a Lantra Ride-on Mower qualification. * Plant identification. * PA1 & PA6 herbicides qualification. * Knowledge of horticultural operations. no -- Principals only. title: Maintenance Caretaker
desc: Maintenance Caretaker Rugby £12.00 - £14.00 per hour Are you an experienced Maintenance Professional looking to transition into the Education sector I am currently looking to recruit a number of Maintenance professionals to work on an ongoing TEMPORARY basis, supporting the School site teams in carrying out day to day general maintenance and site work in Schools across Rugby. There will be full time and part time positions available throughout the School year which run for a variety amount of time. There may also be an opportunity to move to a permanent contract within the Schools although this is not guaranteed. You must be available to work straight away and be flexible with the working hours as some Schools require staff to work split shift patterns. As a full time temporary school caretaker, the school will expect you to essentially be a permanent member of staff so you will be expected to: « Carry out general maintenance of the school as well as litter picking « Carry out odd jobs delegated to you by the supervisor « Open and close the school building « Work independently and as a team to ensure tasks are completed safely and efficiently « Set alarms You will be required to fully register with us including providing right to work documents along with obtaining an Enhanced Child Workforce DBS that will be process by us but come at a cost of £47.20 (unless you already have one registered on the update service ). Please only apply if you are able to do this. I am keen to speak to experienced Maintenance professionals who are interested in working in schools. Please apply above and I will be in touch. Alternatively, if you know of anybody who might be interested then we offer generous referral fees! To find out more about Aspire People head to our website (url removed) Aspire People Limited provides services as an Education Agency and an Education Employment Business. Aspire People is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of pupils and expects every candidate to share this commitment. Placements are subject, to appropriate Child Protection screening, including checks with former employers and the Disclosure and Barring Checks. no -- Principals only. title: Landscape & Visual Impact Assessment Specialist
desc: We are seeking a landscape architect – at project or more senior level – specialising (or keen to specialise) in LVIA/landscape planning to join our established LVIA team in our office in Blackrock. We provide a specialist LVIA service to complement our verified photomontage and CGIs services. We have a large client base, a growing workload and are involved in some of the most exciting urban projects in the country. Increasingly, we are becoming involved in projects at feasibility and early design stage, advising on building height and massing parameters. We also work on transport and renewables projects, tourism projects, etc. Requirements: The ideal candidate will have: A degree in landscape architecture and membership of the ILI (or LI); Experience of LVIA preparation: Good knowledge of the GLVIA, EPA guidelines for EIAR, etc. Excellent research, analysis and report writing skills; Good knowledge of the planning system, processes and hierarchy of policy documents; Full driving licence; Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a busy but pleasant work environment. If you are interested in the position, please email , attaching your CV and one or more examples of your LVIA work (applications will be treated in confidence). For more information call Richard Butler on 01 2899039 / 0872350526. no -- Principals only. Recruiters, please don’t contact this job advertiser. no -- Please, no phone calls about this job! no -- Reposting this message elsewhere is NOT OK.
